amendment.description: Amendment reduces land acquisition funding by $5 million, increases the clean coal technology deferral by $66 million, and imposes a 0.48 percent across-the-board reduction to domestic discretionary programs in the bill for a total reduction of $140 million.
amendment.purpose: An amendment printed in H. Rept. 106-228 to reduce land acquisition funding by $5 million, increase clean coal technology deferral by $66 million, and impose a .48 percent reduction to each account, program, activity, and project.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Young (FL) amendment (A019) Agreed to by voice vote.
